title: Luke Mitchell lands a role in upcoming blockbuster Without Remorse alongside Michael B. Jordan
text:
He's the former Home and Away star who's trying to make his mark in Hollywood.

And on Tuesday, Luke Mitchell announced that he has landed a role in the upcoming blockbuster, Without Remorse.

The 34-year-old Australian actor joins Black Panther star Michael B. Jordan, 32, in the film, with Michael set to play the leading role of John Clark.

He's a long way from Summer Bay! Former Home and Away star Luke Mitchell (pictured) has landed a role in upcoming blockbuster Without Remorse alongside Black Panther star Michael B. Jordan

Luke has been signed on to play Rowdy, a member of John Clark's CIA team.

The film centres around CIA agent, John, whose girlfriend gets murdered by a drug lord.

Luke took to Instagram to share the happy news with his followers.

Star Power: The 34-year-old Australian actor joins Black Panther star Michael B. Jordan, 32, (pictured) who will have the leading role of John Clark

'Get ready!! #WithoutRemorse,' he wrote, sharing a screenshot of Deadline.com's announcement.

His former Home and Away co-stars quick to send their congratulations under the post.

Lincoln Lewis commented: 'Massive congrats mate! That's bloody awesome.'

'Yes, bloody fantastic mate. Congratulations', Georgie Parker commented.

Supportive! His former Home and Away co-stars quick to send their congratulations under the post. Lincoln Lewis (pictured) wrote: 'Massive congrats mate! That's bloody awesome'

Remember this? Luke (left) rose to fame after he played teenager Romeo Smith on Channel Seven's long-running soap based in the fictional town of Summer Bay. (Pictured alongside former co-star and now wife Rebecca Breeds on the soap)

Luke rose to fame after he played teenager Romeo Smith on Channel Seven's long-running soap based in the fictional town of Summer Bay.

The acting hunk has found fame since Home and Away in US TV shows Blindspot and The Code.

He currently splits his time between Los Angeles and Sydney, with his co-star-turned-wife Rebecca Breeds, who he married in 2013.
